docs.snippet: Rashaan Salaam, the 1994 trophy winner, was found dead this month. Now, many wonder if brain damage and the pressure of living up to Heisman hopes contributed to his end....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rashaan Salaam, the 1994 trophy winner, was found dead this month. Now, many wonder if brain damage and the pressure of living up to Heisman hopes contributed to his end.
docs.abstract: Friends and family of former Colorado running back Rashaan Salaam, who won Heisman Trophy in 1994, are questioning whether his early career success had role in his suicide in early December; Salaam reached pinnacle of success at age 20 and subsequently had professional football career hobbled by injuries, central factor in his known depression--common symptom of brain disease, chronic traumatic encephalopathy, that has afflicted scores of players.

headline.main: The Long, Lonely Fall of a Heisman Trophy Winner
headline.print_headline: After the Heisman, a Long, Lonely Slide
